TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Sandy, mixed, frigid Typic Endoaquolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Medano fine sandy loam - grassland.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
Oi--2 inches to 0; undecomposed organic material consisting mainly of grass roots and leaves.  (0 to 2 inches thick)
A1--0 to 8 inches; gray (10YR 5/1) fine sandy loam, black (10YR 2/1) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure parting to very fine granular; soft, very friable; calcareous; moderately alkaline; gradual smooth boundary.  (0 to 10 inches thick)
A2g--8 to 18 inches; grayish-brown (10YR 5/2) loamy sand, very dark brown (10YR 2/2) moist; common medium distinct gray (2.5Y 5/1) and olive brown (2.5Y 7/6) moist mottles; single grained; loose; mildly alkaline; gradual, wavy boundary.  (5 to 20 inches thick)
Cg--18 to 60 inches; light brownish-gray (10YR 6/2) loamy sand, dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) moist; common medium distinct gray (2.5Y 5/1) and olive brown (2.5Y 4/6) moist mottles; single grained; loose; mildly alkaline.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Alamosa County, Colorado; 1,600 feet south and 1,900 feet east of the NW corner of Sec. 17, T. 40 N., R. 12 E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  The Medano soils are calcareous in the surface horizons but are noncalcareous below depths of 20 inches.  The particle size control section is loamy fine sand, loamy sand, or sand, but exclude loamy very fine sands.  Rock fragments range from 0 to 15 percent by volume in a major part of the control section and are mainly less than 3 inches in diameter.  Mean annual soil temperature ranges from 43 to 45 degrees F, and mean summer soil temperature ranges from 60 to 63 degrees F.
The A horizon has hue of 2.5Y through 7.5YR, value of 4 or 5, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of 1 through 3.  It is moderately or strongly alkaline.
The C horizon has hue of 5Y through 7.5YR, value of 5 or 6 dry, 3 through 6 moist, and chroma of 2 through 4.  It is neutral or mildly alkaline.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Fossum, Hamar, Hangaard, Isan, Isanti, and Venlo series.  Fossum soils are calcareous throughout and have visible accumulation of calcium carbonate in the A horizon.  Hamar, Hangaard, and Venlo series are noncalcareous in the upper part of the control section and become calcareous with increasing depth.  Isan and Isanti soils are acid throughout the control section.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  The Medano soils are on low flood plains and the lower ends of alluvial fans.  Slope gradients range from 0 to 6 percent.   The soils formed in alluvium.  The average annual precipitation is 7 to 9 inches, with peak periods of precipitation in the spring and summer.  The mean annual temperature is 41 to 44 degrees F, and the mean summer temperature is 59 to 61 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the McGinty and Vastine soils.  McGinty soils have calcic horizons at depths of less than 40 inches.  Vastine soils have medium to moderately fine textured upper control sections with more than 18 percent clay and overlie beds of sand and gravel.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Poorly drained; slow runoff; rapid permeability but soil has a high water table that ranges within 1.5 to 3.0 feet during spring seasons.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  These soils are used as native pastureland and for irrigated hay meadow or irrigated pasture.  Native vegetation is mainly sedges, rushes, and other water-tolerant grasses and plants.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  South-central Colorado.  The series is of moderate extent.
